Title: BrightHR Lite Style Guide
User_Story: As a UI designer, I want a consistent style guide so that all interfaces maintain a professional and uniform appearance.
Functional_Requirements: Primary colors: Blue (#3B82F6), Neutral Gray (#6B7280), White (#FFFFFF); Typography: Sans-serif (Inter or system default); Spacing: Tailwind defaults with custom scale (4px increments); Buttons: Rounded-md, shadow-sm; Forms: Input borders gray-300, focus blue-500
Non_Functional_Requirements: Responsive design adherence; Accessibility: WCAG AA compliance (contrast ratios >4.5:1); Performance: Minimal CSS bloat via Tailwind purge
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. All wireframes use defined colors and typography; 2. Button styles match across components; 3. Responsive breakpoints (sm, md, lg) applied consistently; 4. No deviations in produced UIs
Vision_Ref: KEY FEATURES: All MVP elements require consistent UI
Notes: Base theme for all WF-xxx; Extendable for dark mode in future

Title: Employee Directory Search
User_Story: As an HR manager, I want to search the employee directory so that I can quickly find employee details.
Functional_Requirements: Search by name or email; Display results in table; Pagination if >10 results
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. User logs in; 2. Enters search term; 3. Results display accurately; 4. No results message if empty

Title: System Performance for Searches
User_Story: As a system administrator, I want the application to respond quickly to user searches so that the user experience remains efficient.
Non_Functional_Requirements: Search queries must return results in under 2 seconds; Support up to 50 concurrent users without degradation
Constraints: Local SQLite database; No external caching in MVP
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. Load test with 50 users shows <2s response; 2. Average search time measured in logs <1.5s; 3. No errors during peak simulation
Notes: Ensures scalability for small business use

Title: Employee Directory Search UI
User_Story: As a user, I want a clean search interface for the employee directory.
Functional_Requirements: Search input field; Table display with Tailwind styling
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. HTML renders search box and table; 2. Tailwind classes applied following STYLE-001; 3. Mobile responsive

Title: Add Employee Profile
User_Story: As an HR manager, I want to add new employee profiles so that the directory stays up-to-date with current staff.
Functional_Requirements: Form for name, email, role, start date; Validation for required fields; Save to database
Non_Functional_Requirements: Secure data entry (input sanitization); Response time <1s on submit
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. User fills form with valid data; 2. Profile saves successfully; 3. New profile appears in search results; 4. Error message for invalid inputs
Vision_Ref: KEY FEATURES: Employee directory (basic profiles with contact info, searchable and updatable)

Title: Add Employee Profile UI
User_Story: As a user, I want an intuitive form to add employee details.
Functional_Requirements: Form inputs for name, email, role, start date; Submit button; Success/error messages
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. HTML renders form with Tailwind styling per STYLE-001; 2. Fields are labeled and accessible; 3. Responsive on mobile; 4. Submit button styled correctly

Title: Submit Leave Request
User_Story: As an employee, I want to submit a leave request so that I can notify HR of my absence plans.
Functional_Requirements: Form for dates, type (vacation/sick), reason; Submit for approval; Email notification to manager
Integrations: Database for leave records; Email service (local simulation in MVP)
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. Employee selects dates and type; 2. Request submits; 3. Status shows pending; 4. Notification sent (simulated)
Vision_Ref: KEY FEATURES: Leave / absence management (request submission, approval workflows)

Title: Leave Request Submission UI
User_Story: As an employee, I want a simple form to request leave.
Functional_Requirements: Date pickers, dropdown for type, textarea for reason; Submit button
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. HTML form renders with Tailwind per STYLE-001; 2. Date inputs functional (HTML5); 3. Mobile-friendly; 4. Validation placeholders

Title: Secure Data Handling for Leave Requests
User_Story: As a system administrator, I want secure handling of leave request data so that sensitive employee information is protected.
Non_Functional_Requirements: Encryption for stored data; Role-based access (employees see own requests, HR sees all); Audit logs for submissions
Integrations: SQLite with encryption extension if needed
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. Requests encrypted in DB; 2. Unauthorized access denied; 3. Logs record submissions; 4. Data export works for user

Title: Update Employee Profile
User_Story: As an HR manager, I want to update existing employee profiles so that the directory remains accurate and current.
Functional_Requirements: Edit form pre-populated with current data; Fields for name, email, role, start date; Validation and save to database
Non_Functional_Requirements: Secure updates (audit trail); Response time <1s on submit
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. User selects profile to edit; 2. Form loads with existing data; 3. Updates save and reflect in search; 4. Error handling for conflicts
Vision_Ref: KEY FEATURES: Employee directory (basic profiles with contact info, searchable and updatable)
Notes: Completes updatable aspect of employee directory

Acceptance_Criteria: 1. HR views pending requests; 2. Approves/rejects with comment; 3. Status updates; 4. Notification sent

Title: View Leave Calendar
User_Story: As an HR manager, I want a calendar view of employee leaves so that I can oversee absences at a glance.
Functional_Requirements: Calendar display showing approved leaves; Filter by employee or type; Monthly/weekly views
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. Calendar loads with leave events; 2. Filters work; 3. Views switch correctly; 4. No unauthorized access
Vision_Ref: KEY FEATURES: Leave / absence management (calendar views for oversight)

Title: Leave Calendar View UI
User_Story: As an HR manager, I want a visual calendar for leave planning.
Functional_Requirements: Calendar grid; Event markers for leaves; Filter dropdowns
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. HTML calendar with Tailwind per STYLE-001; 2. Event styling; 3. Responsive; 4. Filters accessible

Title: Upload Document
User_Story: As an HR manager, I want to upload documents for employees so that contracts and policies are stored securely.
Functional_Requirements: File upload form; Associate with employee; Supported formats (PDF, DOC); Store securely
Integrations: Local file system or database blob
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. Select and upload file; 2. Associates with profile; 3. Stores without corruption; 4. Access restricted

Title: Document Upload UI

Title: Secure Document Storage
User_Story: As a system administrator, I want secure storage and access for uploaded documents to protect sensitive information.
Non_Functional_Requirements: Encryption at rest; Role-based access; Audit logs for uploads/views
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. Files encrypted on upload; 2. Access only to authorized users; 3. Logs track actions; 4. Export/delete functional

Title: View Employee Documents
User_Story: As an HR manager, I want to view and download employee documents so that I can access contracts and policies when needed.
Functional_Requirements: List of documents associated with employee; View/download buttons; Preview for supported formats
Integrations: Local file system or database blob
Constraints: GDPR compliance (access logging, no unauthorized views)

Vision_Ref: KEY FEATURES: Document storage (secure upload and access for contracts, policies, and compliance docs)

Title: View Employee Documents UI
User_Story: As an HR manager, I want an interface to browse and access employee documents.
Functional_Requirements: Employee selector; Document list with preview/download links; Responsive table
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. HTML renders selector and table with Tailwind per STYLE-001; 2. Buttons/links for actions; 3. Mobile responsive; 4. ARIA labels for accessibility

Title: User Authentication
User_Story: As a user, I want to log in to the system so that I can access my personalized HR features securely.
Functional_Requirements: Login form with email/password; Role-based session (HR/Employee); Logout functionality
Non_Functional_Requirements: Secure authentication (hashed passwords); Session timeout after 30min inactivity
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. Valid credentials grant access; 2. Invalid login shows error; 3. Role determines visible features; 4. Logout clears session
Vision_Ref: CONSTRAINTS: Secure access implied in all features
Notes: Foundational security for MVP; Enables role-based access

Title: User Login UI

Functional_Requirements: Email and password inputs; Submit button; Error message display
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. HTML form with Tailwind per STYLE-001; 2. Inputs labeled and secure (type=password); 3. Responsive on all devices; 4. Error states styled

Title: Role-Based Access Control
User_Story: As a system administrator, I want role-based access so that users see only appropriate features and data.
Non_Functional_Requirements: Enforce HR vs Employee permissions; Audit unauthorized attempts; Scalable to future roles
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. Employees can't access HR views; 2. HR can access all; 3. Permissions checked on each page load; 4. Logs unauthorized access
Notes: Supports secure, differentiated user experiences in MVP

Title: View Own Leave Requests
User_Story: As an employee, I want to view my own leave requests so that I can track their status.
Functional_Requirements: List of personal requests with status (pending/approved/rejected); Details on each
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. Employee logs in; 2. Sees only own requests; 3. Statuses accurate; 4. No access to others' data
Vision_Ref: KEY FEATURES: Leave / absence management (self-service implied)
Notes: Enhances employee self-service for leave tracking

Title: View Own Leave Requests UI
User_Story: As an employee, I want a dashboard for my leave history.
Functional_Requirements: Table of requests with dates, types, status; Details modal or expand
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. HTML table with Tailwind per STYLE-001; 2. Status badges styled; 3. Mobile responsive; 4. ARIA for table navigation

User_Story: As an employee, I want to update my own profile details so that I can keep my contact information current without HR intervention.
Functional_Requirements: Edit form pre-populated with current personal data; Editable fields: email, phone, address; Validation and save to database with HR notification
Non_Functional_Requirements: Secure updates (audit trail, employee-only access); Response time <1s on submit
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. Employee logs in and accesses own profile; 2. Form loads with existing editable data; 3. Updates save and HR is notified; 4. Invalid inputs show errors; 5. Changes reflect in directory search
Vision_Ref: KEY FEATURES: Employee directory (basic profiles with contact info, searchable and updatable)
Notes: Fills gap in employee self-service for profile updates, aligning with Vision's updatable profiles

Functional_Requirements: Pre-filled form inputs for editable fields (email, phone, address); Save and cancel buttons; Success message with notification info
Non_Functional_Requirements: Responsive design; Accessibility (labels, ARIA for inputs)
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. HTML renders editable form with Tailwind styling per STYLE-001; 2. Fields labeled and accessible; 3. Responsive on mobile; 4. Save/cancel buttons styled; 5. Success message displays correctly

Title: Local Mac Environment Setup
User_Story: As a developer, I want a simple local setup for the Mac so that I can run the app easily without external dependencies.
Non_Functional_Requirements: Run entirely locally on macOS (Ventura+); Use SQLite as lightweight, file-based DB; Node.js v18+ backend with Express; React frontend on localhost (ports 3000 for frontend, 3001 for backend); Include npm scripts in package.json: "start" (runs npm install if needed, starts backend via "npm run dev:backend" and frontend via "npm run dev:frontend" in parallel using concurrently); "stop" (kills Node processes on ports 3000/3001 using cross-platform tools like kill-port).
Integrations: Local SQLite DB; npm/yarn for deps.
Constraints: Mac-compatible setup (e.g., Homebrew for Node); Cross-platform portability (relative paths); Budget under $5K.
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. "npm run start" launches the full app on Mac (backend on 3001, frontend on 3000); 2. All data persists in local SQLite file; 3. "npm run stop" cleanly terminates processes; 4. Setup completes with local resources only; 5. Tests pass locally (e.g., Jest smoke test after start).
Vision_Ref: CONSTRAINTS: Local run on Mac, SQLite
Notes: Enforces lightweight MVP; npm scripts enable simple command-line invocation (e.g., npm start/stop).
